messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>
> Morten,
>
> Does this work for you?
>
> import static org.junit.Assume.assumeTrue;
>
> @Test public void doSomeOnlineStuff() {
> assumeTrue(currentlyOnline());
> // ... rest of test
> }
>
> This will short-circuit ignore the test if currentlyOnline() is false.
> The implementation of currentlyOnline is up to you.

Thanks. Will try!

BTW: This seems to work if you are curious :-)

public static boolean currentlyOnline() throws SocketException
{
Enumeration<NetworkInterface> enet = NetworkInterface.getNetworkInterfaces();

while ( enet.hasMoreElements() )
{
NetworkInterface net = enet.nextElement();

if ( net.isLoopback() )
continue;

if ( net.getDisplayName().startsWith("vmnet"))
continue;

if ( net.isUp() ) {
return true;
}
}

return false;
}
